thread.title: Escaped tarantula grounds plane near Baltimore
thread.title_full: Escaped tarantula grounds plane near Baltimore

author: cnbc.com
title: Escaped tarantula grounds plane near Baltimore
text:
Henrik Sorensen | Getty Images Tarantula escapes on Delta plane in Baltimore. A tarantula that escaped in the cargo hold of a passenger flight from Maryland 's BWI airport to Atlanta grounded the plane and sent passengers onto another flight.
Brian Kruse, spokesman for Delta Air Lines , tells The Baltimore Sun that baggage handlers noticed a baboon tarantula had gotten out of its container on Flight 1525 Wednesday night.
Read More Nuts on a plane: Snacks dispute could cost $553,000
Kruse says the captain grounded the plane so it could be searched for any additional arachnids. Passengers were put on another flight.
Kruse says the spider was confined to the cargo hold and never entered the cabin. No other tarantulas were found.
Read More Now boarding at Gate 1: Your dogs, cats and other small pets
